channel.title: I need help

item.title: I need help
item.dc:creator: @Reidon Reidon
item.description:
@Reidon wrote:

X F U R Y X:

Do you even have a silab capable server?

I’m new to all this, so I have no idea. >_< I’m using Project16 v6, so you tell me.

[quote=“yazoomafroo, post:3, topic:160527”]yeah just delete that it of code in your item.java because trust me you dont need it. i had problems with it and it comes up as a complete different error when u compile but it is that. i did it yesterday and now mine works =]

btw i think it maybe an error on obeypk is thats what your using[/quote]

I deleted that part of the code, started up the server, tried to give myself the swords, and this happened

[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 25, 2007, 05:49:16 PM[/size][hr]Sorry for the bump - but any ideas?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 25, 2007, 05:49:56 PM[/size][hr]Ah… I can’t bump… bummer.

item.title: I need help
item.dc:creator: @Reidon Reidon
item.description:
@Reidon wrote:

Hey guys!

I need a bit of help. When I try to log into my server, I get this error(s).

It started when I finished following this tutorial -http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,216385.0.html

I thought I did everything right - I guess I was wrong. The problem seems to be within this bit piece of code here

try { FileInputStream dataIn = new FileInputStream(new File("data/twohanded.dat")); while ((c = dataIn.read()) != -1) { if (c == 0) itemTwoHanded[counter] = false; else itemTwoHanded[counter] = true; counter++; } dataIn.close(); itemTwoHanded[11961] = true; itemTwoHanded[11962] = true; itemTwoHanded[11963] = true; itemTwoHanded[11964] = true; } catch (IOException e) {

I’m not really sure where I’ve gone wrong, so any help at all would be great!

Read full topic
